bug.author: sxjscience
bug.summary: [Doc] Overlapping between footer and the left column + Strange nav-link highlighting
bug.description: Footer looks strange: See https://mxnet.incubator.apache.org/versions/1.1.0/architecture/index.html and https://mxnet.incubator.apache.org/versions/1.1.0/api/c++/index.html There is overlapping between the footer and the left column. The chosen nav-link is not highlighted. The current behavior is quite strange. Click "Docs - Architectures" and Github is highlighted. Click "Docs - Tutorials" and Gluon is highlighted.

comments.comment: I've looked at the footer issue and had some help from a couple of people and we can't figure it out. Seems like it would take removing the customizations on the sphinx nav bars which is a can of worms.
Maybe adding a few empty paragraphs to the page would help to push the footer down?
Yes, that would work, but it might make for some weirdness on mobile. It's a workaround for sure.
